>>>>> "Nic" == Nic James Ferrier <nferrier@...> writes:

    Nic> I wanted to write code to PUT an entity to a uri. But the
    Nic> code uses an HTML FORM convention to describe the entity; eg:

    Nic> I'm pretty sure this is a legitimate thing to do. Anybody
    Nic> else here have an opinion?

I use it all the time.

But yeah, you tend to be patching stuff, even new frameworks such as
prototype.js, so people on most backends are still stuck in HTML Form
world instead of looking at what the HTTP spec actually says.
